intro: Antirrhinum latifolium var. hybridum, commonly known as the broadleaf snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous flowers along its stems. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
